question.body: Which are not blood vessel structures associated with nephron?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The glomerulus id part of the renal corpuscle.
Incorrect. The peritubular capillaries are capillary beds that branch off the efferent areterioles and are associated with the proximal and distal convolute tubules in the renal cortex.
Incorrect. The vasa recta capillaries are capillary beds that branch off the efferent arterioles and are associated with the nephron loop in the renal medulla.
Correct. The alveolar capillaries are capillary beds in the lung.

part.hint: check the figure of the nephron and the nephron blood supply.
